title: School Digital Materials Amendments

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel

general_provisions: This bill amends and enacts provisions regarding the accessibility of sensitive material through digital instructional material in a school setting.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state auditor to establish and oversee a digital materials regulator (regulator), including reporting on the actions of the regulator to the Education Interim Committee;<hr><ltbullet>requires the regulator to:<hr><ltbullet1>investigate allegations regarding sensitive material in digital instructional materials;<hr><ltbullet1>impose a fine on a vendor that provides digital access to sensitive material in a school setting; and<hr><ltbullet1>make recommendations regarding the termination of contracts with fined vendors;<hr><ltbullet>includes information regarding sensitive material in the information the state board provides through a certain parent portal;<hr><ltbullet>allows the regulator to initiate a sensitive material review in any local education agency (LEA);<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to report alleged sensitive material violations involving digital instructional material that a vendor provides to the regulator;<hr><ltbullet>requires each LEA to:<hr><ltbullet1>provide certain information to parents at the time of student registration each year; and<hr><ltbullet1>maintain a section on the homepage of the LEA's website regarding sensitive material reporting;<hr><ltbullet>allows the state board, an LEA, or the Utah Education and Telehealth Network (UETN) to rescind certain contracts if a vendor does not remove access to digital sensitive material;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board, an LEA, or UETN to:<hr><ltbullet1>provide certain notice to each vendor with which the entity contracts to provide digital instructional material in a school setting; and<hr><ltbullet1>ensure that any database or device which a student may access uses a filter or other software to prohibit access to sensitive material; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
